JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG granted , in part , claims brought by a certain PERSON against the applicant and , inter alia , recognised his title to a share in a flat owned by the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE on the applicant 's appeal and dismissed PERSON 's claims . This appeal judgment became final and binding .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant sold the flat to a third person , S.
CARDINAL . On DATE Z. lodged an application for supervisory review of the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE a judge of ORG sent the case to its ORG for consideration by way of supervisory review .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG reassessed the evidence , quashed the appeal judgment of CARDINAL DATE and upheld the judgment of DATE , granting ORG 's claims in part .
CARDINAL . According to the applicant , neither she nor her lawyer attended the hearing due to the authorities ' failure to notify them of its date and time .

CARDINAL . NORP The relevant domestic law governing the supervisory review procedure at the material time is summed up in the ORG 's judgment in the case of Sobelin and Others ( see Sobelin and Others v. GPE , nos . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , et seq . , § § DATE , CARDINAL DATE ) .
